member.name: M:VRage.Game.MyDefinitionBase.Postprocess
member.summary:
Override this in case you want to do some postprocessing of the definition before the game starts. Prefer to use MyDefinitionPostprocessor instead.
Postprocess is useful if you want to process the definition before the game begins,
but you only want to do it when all the definitions are loaded and merged.

member.name: T:VRage.Game.MyDefinitionId
member.summary: Prefer getting definition ID using object builder used to create the item. If you have automatic rifle, in its Init method create new MyDefinitionId using TypeId and SubtypeName of object builder. Do not write specific values in code, as data comes from XML and if those change, code needs to change as well.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.MyDefinitionId.FromContent(VRage.ObjectBuilders.MyObjectBuilder_Base)
member.summary: Creates a new definition ID from a given content.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.MyDefinitionId.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to create a definition ID from a definition string, which has the form (using ores as an example) "MyObjectBuilder_Ore/Iron". The first part must represent an existing type. If it does not, an exception will be thrown. The second (the subtype) is not enforced. See TryParse for a parsing method that does not throw an exception.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.MyDefinitionId.TryParse(System.String,VRage.Game.MyDefinitionId@)
member.summary: Attempts to create a definition ID from a definition string, which has the form (using ores as an example) "MyObjectBuilder_Ore/Iron". The first part must represent an existing type, while the second (the subtype) is not enforced.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyCubeGrid.IsInSameLogicalGroupAs(VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyCubeGrid)
member.summary: Determines whether this grid is in the same logical group as the other, meaning they're connected either mechanically or via blocks like connectors. Be aware that using merge blocks combines grids into one, so this function will not filter out grids connected that way.

summary.para: Determines whether this grid is mechanically connected to the other. This is any grid connected with rotors or pistons or other mechanical devices, but not things like connectors. This will in most cases constitute your complete construct.

Be aware that using merge blocks combines grids into one, so this function will not filter out grids connected that way. Also be aware that detaching the heads of pistons and rotors will cause this connection to change.

member.name: E:VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyDLCs.DLCInstalled
member.summary: Called when a new DLC is installed by a client. On the client, this only reports DLC installed on the local client.
member.remarks:
The first action argument is the client SteamId. The second argument is the DLC AppId. This event will be called on the server each time a player connects.
Note:
Space Engineers 2013 is AppId 573900
Deluxe Edition Artwork is AppId 573161 Neither of the above DLC are present in the list returned by . In addition, will throw when passed either of those AppIds.

member.summary: Connections which lock physics. i.e. connectors. Includes Logical and Mechanical connnections.

member.summary: Connections by rotor, piston, suspension.

member.name: F:VRage.Game.ModAPI.GridLinkTypeEnum.Electrical
member.summary: Connections by rotor, piston, suspension and connectors if they transfer energy.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyMultiplayer.SendMessageToServer(System.UInt16,System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send message to server
member.param: Some random number from 0-65535, that you use in . Dont use beautiful numbers like 11111, 22222. You may conflict with other mods.
When false, message may not arrive to client, but faster. They also may come in different order, that they have been sent. Unreliable messages are also limited by 1024 bytes.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyMultiplayer.SendMessageToOthers(System.UInt16,System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send message to everyone on server (including server)
member.param: Some random number from 0-65535, that you use in . Dont use beautiful numbers like 11111, 22222. You may conflict with other mods.
When false, message may not arrive to client, but faster. Unreliable messages are also limited by 1024 bytes.

member.summary: Send message to one recipient.
member.param: Some random number from 0-65535, that you use in . Dont use beautiful numbers like 11111, 22222. You may conflict with other mods.
When false, message may not arrive to client, but faster. Unreliable messages are also limited by 1024 bytes.

Call function. Should be same that was registered

member.name: M:VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyPhysics.GetCollisionLayer(System.String)
member.summary: Given a string, gets the numeric value for the collision layer. Default: 0. TargetDummyLayer = 6 BlockPlacementTestCollisionLayer = 7 MissileLayer = 8 NoVoxelCollisionLayer = 9 LightFloatingObjectCollisionLayer = 10 VoxelLod1CollisionLayer = 11 NotCollideWithStaticLayer = 12 StaticCollisionLayer = 13 CollideWithStaticLayer = 14 DefaultCollisionLayer = 15 DynamicDoubledCollisionLayer = 16 KinematicDoubledCollisionLayer = 17 CharacterCollisionLayer = 18 NoCollisionLayer = 19 DebrisCollisionLayer = 20 GravityPhantomLayer = 21 CharacterNetworkCollisionLayer = 22 FloatingObjectCollisionLayer = 23 ObjectDetectionCollisionLayer = 24 VirtualMassLayer = 25 CollectorCollisionLayer = 26 AmmoLayer = 27 VoxelCollisionLayer = 28 ExplosionRaycastLayer = 29 CollisionLayerWithoutCharacter = 30 RagdollCollisionLayer = 31
member.param: Name of collision layer. See MyPhysics.CollisionLayers for valid names.
member.remarks: Default string used if not valid: DefaultCollisionLayer

member.name: T:VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyPlayerCollection
member.summary: ModAPI interface giving control on players

member.name: M:VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyPlayerCollection.ExtendControl(VRage.Game.ModAPI.Interfaces.IMyControllableEntity,VRage.ModAPI.IMyEntity)
member.summary: Control extension and reduction is a mechanism that saves the control of other entities than IMyControllableEntities. A typical example is a cockpit inside a cube grid - you control the cockpit, but you want to "extend" the control to the cube grid as well. You can extend the control multiple times, but you always have to extend from the "base" entity, i.e. the cockpit in our example. The same goes for control reduction: always reduce to the "base" entity
member.param: Entity that already control. Example: cockpit
Entity that would get control. Example: grid
member.remarks: Same as

member.param: List, that would receive connected players
When null, or returns true, would receive player

member.returns: True, if both entities under control of one player

member.name: M:VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyPlayerCollection.ReduceControl(VRage.Game.ModAPI.Interfaces.IMyControllableEntity,VRage.ModAPI.IMyEntity)
member.summary: Control extension and reduction is a mechanism that saves the control of other entities than IMyControllableEntities. A typical example is a cockpit inside a cube grid - you control the cockpit, but you want to "extend" the control to the cube grid as well. You can extend the control multiple times, but you always have to extend from the "base" entity, i.e. the cockpit in our example. The same goes for control reduction: always reduce to the "base" entity
member.param: Entity that would keep control. Example: cockpit
Entity that would loose control. Example: grid
member.remarks: Same as
Reducing control only if both entities were controlled by same player

member.name: M:VRage.Game.ModAPI.Ingame.IMyCubeGrid.IsSameConstructAs(VRage.Game.ModAPI.Ingame.IMyCubeGrid)

summary.para: Determines whether this grid is connected to the other. This is any grid connected with rotors or pistons or other mechanical devices, but not things like connectors. This will in most cases constitute your complete construct.

Be aware that using merge blocks combines grids into one, so this function will not filter out grids connected that way. Also be aware that detaching the heads of pistons and rotors will cause this connection to change.

member.returns: True if grid connected with linking

member.name: T:VRage.Game.ModAPI.Ingame.Utilities.MyCommandLine
member.summary: A utility class to parse arguments from a command line string. Switches are defined with hyphen (-switch). Quotes can be placed around an argument to parse verbatim, but inner quotes will be copied verbatim. For example, "one"two" will result in the string one"two.

member.name: T:VRage.Game.ModAPI.Ingame.Utilities.MyIni

summary.para: A configuration class to parse and create a text string resembling the old fashioned INI format, but with support for multiline values.
Do not forget that parsing is a time-consuming task. Keep your parsing to a minimum.

example.para: Using MyIni to deal with CustomData end-user configuration:
Using MyIni to deal with internal storage:

member.remarks: This class is NOT THREAD SAFE as it's optimized for programmable block use.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.ModAPI.Ingame.Utilities.MyIni.HasSection(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the given configuration contains what looks like the given section. It does not verify that the content is actually in a valid format, just if there's a line starting with [section].

member.name: P:VRage.Game.ModAPI.Ingame.Utilities.MyIni.EndContent

member.name: T:VRage.Game.Entity.MyGameLogic
member.summary:
This is mostly a copy of the updating system present in MyEntities.
The old style of GameLogic component was tied to entity updates. This meant that when the entity removed one of its update flags, the component would stop updating with no warning.
Here we update GameLogic components separately from the containing entity.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Entity.MyGameLogic.RegisterForUpdate(VRage.Game.Components.MyGameLogicComponent)
member.summary: Registers a component to the update system. Only use for first-time registration! If changing update flags, use ChangeUpdate!

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Entity.MyGameLogic.UnregisterForUpdate(VRage.Game.Components.MyGameLogicComponent)
member.summary: Unregisters a component from the update system. Only use when disposing a component! If changing update flags, use ChangeUpdate!

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Entity.MyGameLogic.ChangeUpdate(VRage.Game.Components.MyGameLogicComponent,VRage.ModAPI.MyEntityUpdateEnum,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Modifies a component's update flags without modifying lists the component is already in. Much more performant than Unregister/Register pattern!

members.member: Weather this material has layers.

Important!
Due to the geometry in question the slope is stored as the cosine (used in dot product).
Meanwhile the dot product for the latitude yields the cosine of the modulus of the compliment of our angle. This means after the maths are done that what we have is the *sine*, so the latitude is stored as the sine.
Rule group defines a material mappable set of surface rules.

member.name: M:VRage.Game.Voxels.IMyStorage.Pin
member.summary:
Pin the storage.
While the storage is pinned it will not be closed, but calls to pin will mark it to close as soon as all pins are disposed.
The pin might not be valid if the storage was already closed. You should always check once you pin the storage that the pin is valid.
member.returns: A storage pin. Must be disposed when no longer in use.

member.summary: Unpins the storage, must not be called directly, used by storage pins.

member.name: M:VRage.ModAPI.IMyEntities.FindFreePlace(VRageMath.Vector3D,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Use to find place that doesn't have any voxels, grids, or physical bodies. If original position can't fill check sphere, new position in some distance is picked. Distance grows each testsPerDistance attempts. Maximum distance from BasePos that can be used is calculated by formula: maxTestCount / testsPerDistance * radius * stepSize
member.param: Radius in which there should be nothing
How many tries should be done, to find free space
Depends how often distance from original position grows
member.returns: Position that can doesn't have voxels, grids and other HkBodies in provided radius

member.name: T:VRage.ModAPI.IMyGridConveyorSystem
member.summary: ModAPI interface giving access to grid-group conveyor system

member.name: M:VRage.ModAPI.IMyGridConveyorSystem.PullItem(VRage.Game.MyDefinitionId,System.Nullable{VRage.MyFixedPoint},VRage.ModAPI.IMyEntity,VRage.Game.ModAPI.IMyInventory,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Implements pull item with possible optional remove. Computation part of this method is done in parallel, so if you call it on new conveyor network, it will not pull anything for the first time. So the best approach is to call it in some steps, so it does not matter that you don't get result instantly. Be careful not to call it every frame as it can degrade performance.
member.param: if true item is removed from inventories instead of transfer

member.name: M:VRage.ModAPI.IMyGridConveyorSystem.PushGenerateItem(VRage.Game.MyDefinitionId,System.Nullable{VRage.MyFixedPoint},VRage.MyFixedPoint@,VRage.ModAPI.IMyEntity,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Implements push item from one source block. Item will be generated from source.
member.param: Amount of items that was transferred
If true, items fill be pushed even though not all can fit the conveyor system. Items that can't fit will be thrown away. If false, items will be pushed into system only when all of them fits.
member.returns: Returns info whether all items could fit in target network or not.

members.member:
Lod controller for voxel meshes implemented in the fashion of the classic clipmap paper.
The original paper: https://web.archive.org/web/20160428150805/http://www.cs.virginia.edu/~gfx/Courses/2002/BigData/papers/Texturing/Clipmap.pdf
This implementation extends the ideas presented in the paper to 3 dimensions and manages a mesh 'sewing' process that joins the boundaries between meshes.

member.summary: Log base two of the size of a cell.

members.member:
Cell cached used by this clipmap. Can be null.
The clipmap uses this cache both for storing recently used meshes in case they may be needed again and also when pre-fetching. If no cache is provided pre-fetching will be disabled.

Process all mesh requests that hit the cache.

members.member:
Process all queued cell updates.
Cell render updates are queued because they deal with render data. As a result we must process them on the render thread.

member.name: M:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmap.Stitch(VRage.Voxels.MyCellCoord,VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyClipmapCellVicinity)
member.summary:
Schedule stitching for a given cell.
If the cell is a cell in the back of it's lod then additional jobs are scheduled to stitch it to the LODs above. Because these jobs all modify the same cell, they are all scheduled as a group in a compound stitch job.
member.param: The coordinate of the cell to be stitched.

members.member:
Manages a clipmap ring.
The clipmap is comprised of concentric 'rings' (actually they are thick walled boxes, but the original paper calls the rings in the 2D case).
Each ring contains meshes of a specific level of detail.

member.name: F:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.m_cells
member.summary: Set of visible cells belonging to this ring.

member.name: F:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.m_cellsRemove
member.summary: Set of cells that will be removed upon the current update.

member.summary: Set of cells that will be added during the current update.

member.summary: Set of cells that will be re-stitched as a result of their forward cells having changed.

member.summary: Last bounds of this ring.

member.name: M:VRage.Voxels.Clipmap.MyVoxelClipmapRing.AddCell(VRageMath.Vector3I)
member.summary:
Introduce a new cell.
Newly added cells are calculated, stitched and then post-processed so they can be rendered.
New cells need time to be constructed, as a result they are placed as dependencies for the parent cell which invariably needs to be removed, but will do so only when all children are ready.

member.summary:
Remove the cell right away.
This method is separated from finish remove so we can have more control over what code paths can modify cells at which times.

member.name: M:VRage.Voxels.DualContouring.MyDualContouringMesher.Calculate(VRage.Entities.Components.MyVoxelMesherComponent,System.Int32,VRageMath.Vector3I,VRageMath.Vector3I,VRage.Voxels.MyStorageDataTypeFlags,VRage.Voxels.MyVoxelRequestFlags,VRage.Voxels.VrVoxelMesh)
member.summary:
Calculate a voxel mesh.
Given the size sz of the range requested the resulting mesh will have sz -1 vertices (given it's dual nature), and sz -2 quads 9given that quads are dual to vertices.
member.param: The Voxel mesher entity component responsible for this request.
The starting range in voxels for the request.
Which properties are to be computed.
Request flags to pass onto the data request performed by the contour.
Mesh to store results into, this mesh will be cleared regardless of the result being empty.

member.name: M:VRage.Voxels.DualContouring.MyDualContouringMesher.GenerateQuads(System.Byte,System.UInt16[],System.Collections.Generic.List{VRage.Game.Voxels.MyVoxelQuad})
member.summary:
Given a vertex configuration determine the quads required to correctly connect those vertices.
To build a cube mask: - assign every vertex in a cube an index equal to its (x,y,z) (dot) (1, 2, 4). - for every corner that has a positive sign, assign the mask bit given by it's index to one. - leave remaining bits in the mask assigned to 0.

member.name: F:VRage.Voxels.DualContouring.MyDualContouringMesher.EdgeTable
member.summary:
Tells based on a cube iso-configuration which edges are crossed by the isosurface
The standard MC table and diagrams from the original implementations and papers index the cube indices as a rotation in the xy plane: Namely the indices for (0,0), (1,0), (0,1) and (1,1) being 0, 1, 3 and 2 repectivelly.
This can be confusing in many cases where one would expect a mo0re traditional Z curve order. So the table here was re ordered in Z order.
Here is a good page about marching cubes. http://paulbourke.net/geometry/polygonise/

members.member:
Read range of data.
The data for the request, providing any optimizations that are requested in there.

Intersect line with storage.
Returnas the tightest line interval that does intersect the storage. The precision of this method varies from storage to storage.
The offsets are normalised.

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.General_Experimental
member.summary: Game may break because Experimental Mode is enabled. It contains many experimental, unofficial and not fully developed features. These were the features that we added to the game throughout its Early Access development, but are now not considered to be an official part of the game. However, we don't want to remove them from the game because many players are used to them. Therefore by default, you are in safe mode with only selected features and limits. Experimental mode was introduced because we want to guarantee flawless gameplay, but we can only do this if we control the boundaries. Mods, unsafe settings, or unofficial features are out of range of what we can guarantee.

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.General_SteamOffline

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.NewGameScreen_Description
member.summary: Space Engineers is primarily a sandbox game, which features non-linear story gameplay thats defined by goals and objectives present in default scenarios, or those created by players for themselves or other players.

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.WorkshopScreen_Description
member.summary: The Workshop offers worlds submitted by other players. Here you can find an array of challenging scenarios, worlds to explore, puzzles to solve and battles to fight, which are all made by the Space Engineers community!

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.WorldSettingsScreen_Description
member.summary: Custom games offer a variety of worlds where you can start your own scenario. Customize the world settings to create the world that you want to explore and challenge yourself with.

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.BlueprintsScreen_Description
member.summary: Ships, stations and any other design can be saved in a blueprint. Here you can find your saved blueprints and those that you are subscribed to on the Workshop.

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.Campaign_Congratulation_Text
member.summary: Were proud to present you with this Veteran Engineer Suit. Wear it with honour. A Veteran Badge has also been added to your main menu to remind you of all your achievements. As a true Space Engineer, its now up to you how far you will push yourself to create, explore and build across the stars. There are still many adventures to experience and challenges to overcome. Good luck!

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.SimpleNewGame_Creative_Description
member.summary: Creative mode. Dont feel like gathering materials, planning logistics? Let your imagination run wild and jump into creative mode! Build gigantic starships and many other types of vehicles, or perhaps you'd like to construct a space elevator? The choice is yours. There is no health in creative mode.

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.SimpleNewGame_LearningToSurvive_Description
member.summary: Restore an old outpost to act as your base of operations and explore the remains of what a once thriving industry left behind. Learn about space engineering or pick a fight, the choice is yours, this is where your career begins!

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.SimpleNewGame_NeverSurrender_Description
member.summary: Survival mode. Start your own space journey. Gather resources, create components and build something truly epic. Discover new challenges and engineer solutions. Explore planets, fly to the moon, navigate space or drill a hole to the center of the Earth. Its up to you!

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.SimpleNewGame_TheFirstJump_Description
member.summary: This scenario offers a linear story with action-packed gameplay, while the majority of Space Engineers scenarios feature unique sandbox environments where players create their own challenges.

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.SimpleNewGame_SparksOfTheFuture_Description
member.summary: Welcome to Sparks of the Future! Enjoy some competition at the shooting-range or on the dance floor. Explore the many shops available at Sparks of the Future Central. Looking for a distraction from your daily activities or do you seek the vibrant city life? You can find it all here at Sparks of the Future!

member.name: F:MyCommonTexts.SimpleNewGame_ScrapRace_Description
member.summary: Scrap Race is racing scenario designed for multiplayer. Pick your vehicle of choice and compete against other lowlifes, thrillseekers, and speed-freaks from across the system. Unlike human life is entertainment here at Pertam the most valuable commodity and we offer the finest! So join today! Get building, get racing, or get left in the dust.
